oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Andrew Jackson to unnamed colonel, August 26, 1817
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A letter from Andrew Jackson to an unnamed colonel that recommended Lieutenant Samuel Houston as sub-agent in the removal of Cherokee from East Tennessee. In the letter, he mentions Nicholas Byers, one of the proprietors of the Unicoi Turnpike.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845; Houston, Sam, 1793-1863; Indian agents; Indian Removal, 1813-1903
Correspondence
